intro: Gaudichaudia pentandra subsp. tristyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
